oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Organic Agriculture in DPRK. A Strategy for Sustainable Development
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Pak, Chang Nam
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil quality
Farming Systems
Regulation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In DPRK, organic agriculture (OA) can contribute to the sustainable development of agriculture and is encouraged by the Government. The conditions are favorable to develop laws for the organic sector, which has several strategic characteristics. The Organic Agriculture Development Association of the DPRK (OADA) presents its activities and plan for the development of OA. OADA has registered remarkable success in the past ten years, but still faces challenges.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Pak, Chang Nam (2014) Organic Agriculture in DPRK. A Strategy for Sustainable Development. Paper at: IFOAM Organic World Congress 2014, Istanbul, Turkey, 13-15 October 2014. [Completed]
